aima.core.probability.domain
Interface FiniteDomain

All Superinterfaces:
DiscreteDomain, Domain
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFiniteDomain, ArbitraryTokenDomain, BooleanDomain, FiniteIntegerDomain
public interface FiniteDomain
extends DiscreteDomain

A Domain over a countable/discrete and finite set of objects.

Author:
Ciaran O'Reilly

Method Summary
 int getOffset(java.lang.Object value)
          The possible values for a finite domain are to have a consistent ordering (whether they are actually ordered by value or not).

isFinite, isInfinite, isOrdered, size
 

Method Detail

getPossibleValues

java.util.Set<? extends java.lang.Object> getPossibleValues()
Returns:
a consistent ordered Set (e.g. LinkedHashSet) of the possible values this domain can take on.

getOffset

int getOffset(java.lang.Object value)
The possible values for a finite domain are to have a consistent ordering (whether they are actually ordered by value or not). This will return an offset into that ordering.

Parameters:
value - a value from the domain.
Returns:
an offset (starting from 0) into the consistent order of the set of possible values.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is not valid for the domain.

getValueAt

java.lang.Object getValueAt(int offset)
Parameters:
offset - an offset into the consistent ordering for this domain.
Returns:
the Object at the specified offset in this domains consistent ordered set of values. null if the offset does not index the domain correctly.
